newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian SIDANKO in 3rd fight for key oil producer.
newsitem.headline: Russian SIDANKO in 3rd fight for key oil producer.

text.p: Russian oil company NK SIDANKO has launched a third bid to wrest back control of prize crude oil producer AO Purneftegaz from state oil holding company Rosneft, SIDANKO said in a statement on Friday.
"The Moscow Arbitration Court has accepted for examination an appeal lodged by AO SIDANKO for SIDANKO's right to ownership of shares of AOOT Purneftegaz," it said.
Sibirskaya Dalnevostochnaya Neftyanaya Kompaniya (SIDANKO) said the court would begin an investigation on March 3.
SIDANKO, a large vertically-integrated oil company, has twice tried but failed to regain control of Purneftegaz.
Its latest appeal is against the State Property Fund and Rosneft.
A 1994 government resolution awarded Purneftegaz to SIDANKO, but a later ruling shifted ownership back to Rosneft.
SIDANKO produced 20.81 million tonnes of crude oil in 1996.
Its main production units include Chernogorneft, Varyoganneftegaz and Kondpetroleum.
Purneftegaz produced about eight million tonnes of oil in 1995, the last year for which figures were available.
Rosneft lost many of its assets under industry restructuring.
